isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine - Model Years Late 1997 to 2003 - Introduction - Engine Description - Chassis Mounted Charge Air Cooler

svcproc.title: Chassis Mounted Charge Air Cooler
svcproc.para: The T 444E diesel engine utilizes a charge air cooling (CAC) system. The cooler is chassis mounted adjacent to the radiator. Air from the turbocharger is pushed through a network of heat exchanging tubes before entering the intake manifold. Outside air flowing over the fins and tubes serves to cool the air charge. The resulting cooled intake air is denser than the compressed (warmed) air, allowing for improved fuel/air ratio in the cylinders during the combustion process. The results are improved emission control and increased power output.
